newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon t-bill auction raises 235.7 bln pounds.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon t-bill auction raises 235.7 bln pounds.

text.p: Lebanon's weekly treasury bill issue of June 19 raised 235.7 billion Lebanese pounds, according to finance ministry results issued on Monday.
The previous issue raised 244.9 billion pounds.
The issue posted a nominal surplus of subscription against maturity of 72 billion pounds. It raised the following amounts (in billion of pounds, previous week in brackets):

The central bank said eight percent of all competitive bids -- those made by Lebanese institutions -- were accepted up to the discount rate and yield for three-month bills and nine percent for six-month bills and 35 percent for one-year bills.
All competitive bids were accepted for the two-year bills.

The bank restricted the acceptance of non-competitive bids -- those made by private individuals and foreign investors -- for the shorter-term bills, approving eight percent up to the discount rate and yield for three-month bills and nine percent for six-month bills.
All non-competitive bids were approved for one-year and two-year bills, it said.
The Lebanese pound closed at 1,540.25 to the U.S. dollar on Monday from 1,540.75 a week earlier and 1,572 a year ago.
